summary: Imagine the trauma of being a female werewolf. Just having to suffer twice every single month for two completely different...
body: Imagine the trauma of being a female werewolf. Just having to suffer twice every single month for two completely different reasons but both affecting her mentally and physically and having to interact within a society that doesn’t understand and know about the illness and jokes “oh it’s probably just her time of the month” everytime she goes past looking pale and tired or snaps out because of the pain.

summary: does no one talk about Sirius and Regulus when he was just sorted into Slytherin? do you think Sirius ever skipped class to find...
body: does no one talk about Sirius and Regulus when he was just sorted into Slytherin? do you think Sirius ever skipped class to find him and sneak him into the Gryffindor common room and listened to him cry about being separated from him because they were never apart before? do you think the Slytherin stigma bled into him and he was afraid he would turn out to be like their parents? do you think Sirius’ heart ached when he saw Regulus being roped into doing something because he knew his little brother wasn’t an evil person and that he carried that bitterness and guilt around after he died? because he promised his first year baby brother that he would never become their parents and that he couldn’t keep it? because Sirius was the one person Regulus loved and if Sirius had called him back, he would have listened? do you ever think about how Sirius died not knowing his brother’s last sacrifice?

summary: do you ever think about the other marauders like before they knew Remus was a werewolf and they accidentally see a glimpse of...
body:
do you ever think about the other marauders like before they knew Remus was a werewolf and they accidentally see a glimpse of his scars (not that Remus doesn’t try his best to hide them) and assume he’s been abused at home? and they still mostly believe that Remus goes home every month to see his sick mother like he says he is? like just imagine them furiously whispering in a hushed discussion when Remus isn’t around and in the end (gently?) ask him about it and he doesn’t fully deny it because to him that story is better than his furry little problem being outed and them being devastated because who would want to hurt this little fluffball? and James absolutely ready to go marching up to McGonagall and demand something be done about it but Remus has this look of utter terror on his face as he begs them not to tell anyone because he’s scared of what might happen if this went public and James not understanding why he wouldn’t want his abuser punished and Sirius being the one who coaxes James out of it because even in his confusion he recognizes the fear on Remus’ face and suddenly he’s back at home peering over the landing with a hand around his brother’s wrist and listening for any sound and he realizes the consequences of taking action against Remus’ abuser so he persuades James to keep his mouth shut and Remus looking at him so gratefully and it dawning on Sirius from both James’ and Remus’ actions that what he’s been going through is abuse too

do you think that might be when Sirius’ heart went out to his friend the night they saw his scars? because he had some of his own?

summary: Harry Potter Gang, Need Your Help
body:
Harry Potter Gang, Need Your Help

Wanted to ask you guys—knowing the breadth of the world building in HP, what’s one of the more interesting original character set ups you’d like to see explored?


One idea I have is a wizard of Korean Descent and how Asian magical practices might clash with classically taught Western ideas of magic. What’s yours?

title: study dates with sirius hc
body:
• the first thing you notice is that he is abnormally punctual
  • you’ve spent enough time with him to know that punctuality isn’t necessarily his strongest suit, he follows his own schedule— which is to say he’s usually at least ten to fifteen minutes late. for everything.
  • come to think of it, you didn’t think that you had ever seen him be on time for something besides your study dates— and even then, he had never been more prepared than you
  • and yet there he was, before you, five minutes before you were supposed to meet
  • he had asked you to a coffee shop out of gratitude for helping him out in his classes
  • initially, you had been surprised that he had asked you, since you figured there were plenty more qualified people to be tutors— but even though you had suggested several students that you thought would be better for the task, he had been completely set on you
  • so you agreed, because who were you to say no?
  • the notion that perhaps he had asked you out of motives that were not entirely academic crossed your mind, but you didn’t want to seem self-absorbed so you pushed all of that away
  • until study sessions actually happened, and then you felt something developing in the center of your chest
  • you couldn’t identify this feeling quite yet
  • this feeling happened to be a deep infatuation with the boy that, despite messing around and being distracted for a grand majority of the time you had known him, carefully listened to you and seemed to genuinely care about what you were saying
  • that is not to say that he didn’t distract you constantly
  • but when you cracked down and got to work, he cared about what he was doing
  • sirius just didn’t want to seem like he was disrespecting the time you were giving him, because although he had his heart set on you tutoring him due to an intense crush he had developed, he really did need to learn all of the things you were telling him
  • yes, his crush was 99% of his reasoning, but that 1% was truly out of desperation
  • and you did an excellent job of tutoring him
  • you were nervous at first, but he had an uncanny way of removing all of your dread, and soon enough, you found that tutoring him was helping you just as equally as it was helping him
  • he was crazily sharp— the questions he asked genuinely made you think and reviewing all of the content was a good refresher
  • plus you loved every second you spent with him
  • he was smart and unbelievably beautiful and he made you feel good— you had never met someone who could make you laugh as much as he did
  • the sweet nicknames came a little later, but when they arrived, you wondered how you would ever be able to focus
  • “wait, and what about this, lovie?”
  • neither of you acknowledged when the nicknames began
  • but once they did, you just
  • melted
  • nothing sounded corny when it came out of his mouth
  • sirius was abundantly genuine in everything he did; it was obvious to you how much he cared about his friends and the time you were investing in him
  • he started bringing you little gifts
  • or what he called “tokens of gratitude”
  • but they were just gifts
  • a crystal he had used earlier in transfiguration, a tiny bundle of dandelions, a pebble that had caught his eye, really anything that he thought was pretty
  • you soon accumulated so many little trinkets that you had a wooden box dedicated to the gifts that sirius had brought you
  • you wouldn’t admit it, but you kept the box by your bed because looking at it made you smile
  • “I think you’re a little sweet on me, sirius”
  • “me? no, where would you get that notion?” and he would smile with flushed cheeks and pretend like he didn’t see your gaze
  • eventually, the study sessions became more like little dates, and he would bring more flowers and the endearments would slip out of his tongue like they were normal
  • and they were, really
  • everything felt right when he would glance up from a textbook and just
  • “can we go over this for a second, love?”
  • and he would make more of an effort to sit closer to you, and you would make an effort to brush your hands against each other more often
  • until finally
  • finally
  • one day, as you were both packing up to leave, he just turns sharply to you and is like
  • “do you want to go on a real date?”
  • and you grinned up at him and said “these weren’t real dates?”
  • and he shook his head, a soft glow in his eyes
  • “just imagine what an official date would be like. can I— I don’t know, treat you to coffee maybe? if you’d like that?”
  • and you nodded, lips pursed to hide a smile “there is nothing I would like more, sirius”
  • and after all that, there he is, sitting in a corner beside a window, before you
  • and when he looks over at you, grinning and looking more beautiful than anyone should really have the right to look, you know that it’s official
  • sirius black is so sweet on you
body_abstract:
• the first thing you notice is that he is abnormally punctual
  • you’ve spent enough time with him to know that punctuality isn’t necessarily his strongest suit, he follows his own schedule— which is to say he’s usually at least ten to fifteen minutes late. for everything.
  • come to think of it, you didn’t think that you had ever seen him be on time for something besides your study dates— and even then, he had never been more prepared than you
  • and yet there he was, before you, five minutes before you were supposed to meet
  • he had asked you to a coffee shop out of gratitude for helping him out in his classes
  • initially, you had been surprised that he had asked you, since you figured there were plenty more qualified people to be tutors— but even though you had suggested several students that you thought would be better for the task, he had been completely set on you
  • so you agreed, because who were you to say no?

tags: Iktsoyh: I know the sound of your heart
summary: I know the sound of your heart
title: I know the sound of your heart
body:
Fandom: Harry Potter
Pairing: Harry Potter/ Draco Malfoy
Summary: Between the orders he had received, and the ones directly from his heart it had drastically made it harder to stay optimistic.
CLASS/CATEGORY| Potions (Angst)
Prompt: Rolled 1 - Prompt A
Harry and Draco think they know each other. One day, they’re tasked with bringing each other down.
Choose either: 1) undercover Aurors -OR- 2) war spies -OR- 3) cell mates - Minimum: 300 words - Maximum: 1301 words. Must have at least one Harry and one Draco POV section.
A/N: @gameofdrarry
Word Count: 1,077
Or read on ao3

Sixth year was predictably, going splendid.  

Each day Harry woke up early (because who needed sleep when all he could dream was that night when he lost his godfather), ate what he could (since it was not appropriate for The Chosen One to starve himself) and to try in completing some of his homework without tipping off anyone how stressed he felt. It had been a long summer. Packed in with a longer break since he had any contact with Malfoy that used to involve snogging. He wanted to stop feeling so glum, so useless, and full of too many expectations that the whole wizarding world placed onto him. It didn’t help that besides playing the savior, The Order had become lenient in giving him a mission, technically a small one, but still potentially important if he played it right. Being the Gryffindor that he was, he took it.  

September had barely started with the cold weather and quizzes that their professors were itching to squeeze into their classes. Harry’s own timetable wouldn’t have been that hard if he liked all his classes, but he did complain on the account that potions was still slotted because he said that he wanted to be an Auror after Hogwarts. The only refuge he received was that he had not been completely alone when it came to heartbreak. Hermione’s own luck sucked too, yet, when he had told her about Malfoy, she had been wary and sympathetic about his feelings. He liked the git, but as their history went, it had been too unstable for anything to remotely come into fruition in a healthy dose.  

It went in hand that Draco Malfoy would never leave his mother’s side. (And Harry understood, because he had known that he himself would protect everyone he loved. The Weasleys, Hermione, Ron, Remus, and, Sirius—he just wanted to help, to survive the war.)

He knew that Malfoy didn’t want anything to do with him. He should have respected his wishes. However, the thing about being a Potter was that he couldn’t let Malfoy go. Not from his thoughts, his dreams and heart.

He wanted to build a bridge back, to construct something that could mend their mistakes from before. Harry’s own selfish desires could backfire on him if Malfoy found out what The Order wanted from them, he knew; but that had been what made him Harry Potter. He took the risks nobody wanted to make. Carved out his grave where he stood when he slipped the cloak to track down Malfoy. It hadn’t been that hard to find him during Prefect duties late at night. It had been effortless to slip into old habits when he called out his name, to reveal his body and have a half-frozen Malfoy in front of him. Practically gapping. In seconds, he enveloped Malfoy inside the cloak for both privacy and desperation to maintain his attention.

They didn’t kiss, even if he missed it, Harry just felt too self-conscious of being so close to the boy he was in love with. The same one that The Order wanted Harry to get cozy again in order to find any leaks of information from the other side. The levels of drama and angst that could loop around his shoulders was astonishing, heavy too when all thoughts centered to pleading if Draco changed his mind and join his side. They could talk it out (because he badly wanted an excuse to have Malfoy in his life again), to make a plan that would ensure Malfoy’s mother safety now that his dad was out of the picture momentarily, he just needed to say the right words. To have the courage to stitch together his mission while still staying true to his heart.

“I know you’re up to something.”  

Malfoy’s eyes narrowed, his lips turned thin. Harry could see how much he wanted to deny the accusation as his body leaned away from Harry’s. (But they knew that he couldn’t. Not when it had been public knowledge about the downfall of the Malfoy name.)  

“We both know that you want sanctuary for your mum. I can give it to you.” Malfoy’s scoff hadn’t hid how skeptical and a cynic he was to hearing that. “Malfoy—” He got cut off.  

“Potter we both know that’s rubbish. If we’re going to be candid about this, I doubt you have that much influence in your little club against him to invoke a deal that would give my mother clemency.”  

“Do you always have to be such a pessimistic git? Malfoy, I know a thing or two about families with a bad history. I know you weren’t exactly that close to your dad compared to your mum. I’m giving you a chance.” For your pardon, for us, he wanted to add.  

Malfoy crossed his arms against his chest as a gust of chilly air blew through them. “Regardless of how distant I’ve been with my father, that doesn’t equate that I would leave him behind to the Dark Lord’s wrath. Malfoys pride themselves of being loyal to family. As such, your band of fans and bodyguards wouldn’t let my family in without something equal to exchange.”  

“Information.” Harry admitted. “They would want an insider to spy and give intel.” 

But that would be too dangerous for any grown adult let alone someone who was still in Hogwarts. He couldn’t gamble Malfoy’s life like that. Not when he was losing too many people from all sides.  

“Potter, just give it up. Leave me alone and keep your head down for all our sakes. What’s done is done.”

Harry stepped closer. “You can’t mean that. Malfoy, don’t walk away from this.” He grabbed one of Malfoy’s hands and placed it over his heart. “I know you want this.”  

Malfoy’s hands were cold, shivering from contact. “No, you don’t.”  

He stuttered. Looked so ready to give up, empty. Harry leaned further and angled for his lips to touch Malfoys when he whispered to him. “Don’t lie to yourself. I want you too.”  

“Don’t. Potter you don’t know what you’re starting.” Please almost escaped from his mouth.  

He trembled when Harry kissed him.




“I have been told you have acquired Potter’s affections.” His robes slid over to his shoes. In close proximity his red eyes pierced straight to his heart. “Good. Use that to your advantage and your mother will stay in perfect health. Is that understood?”  

“Yes, My Lord.”

Each day Harry woke up early (because who needed sleep when all he could dream was that night when he lost his godfather), ate what he could (since it was not appropriate for The Chosen One to starve himself) and to try in completing some of his homework without tipping off anyone how stressed he felt. It had been a long summer. Packed in with a longer break since he had any contact with Malfoy that used to involve snogging. He wanted to stop feeling so glum, so useless, and full of too many expectations that the whole wizarding world placed onto him. It didn’t help that besides playing the savior, The Order had become lenient in giving him a mission, technically a small one, but still potentially important if he played it right. Being the Gryffindor that he was, he took it.  

September had barely started with the cold weather and quizzes that their professors were itching to squeeze into their classes. Harry’s own timetable wouldn’t have been that hard if he liked all his classes, but he did complain on the account that potions was still slotted because he said that he wanted to be an Auror after Hogwarts. The only refuge he received was that he had not been completely alone when it came to heartbreak. Hermione’s own luck sucked too, yet, when he had told her about Malfoy, she had been wary and sympathetic about his feelings. He liked the git, but as their history went, it had been too unstable for anything to remotely come into fruition in a healthy dose.  

It went in hand that Draco Malfoy would never leave his mother’s side. (And Harry understood, because he had known that he himself would protect everyone he loved. The Weasleys, Hermione, Ron, Remus, and, Sirius—he just wanted to help, to survive the war.)

He knew that Malfoy didn’t want anything to do with him. He should have respected his wishes. However, the thing about being a Potter was that he couldn’t let Malfoy go. Not from his thoughts, his dreams and heart.

He wanted to build a bridge back, to construct something that could mend their mistakes from before. Harry’s own selfish desires could backfire on him if Malfoy found out what The Order wanted from them, he knew; but that had been what made him Harry Potter. He took the risks nobody wanted to make. Carved out his grave where he stood when he slipped the cloak to track down Malfoy. It hadn’t been that hard to find him during Prefect duties late at night. It had been effortless to slip into old habits when he called out his name, to reveal his body and have a half-frozen Malfoy in front of him. Practically gapping. In seconds, he enveloped Malfoy inside the cloak for both privacy and desperation to maintain his attention.

They didn’t kiss, even if he missed it, Harry just felt too self-conscious of being so close to the boy he was in love with. The same one that The Order wanted Harry to get cozy again in order to find any leaks of information from the other side. The levels of drama and angst that could loop around his shoulders was astonishing, heavy too when all thoughts centered to pleading if Draco changed his mind and join his side. They could talk it out (because he badly wanted an excuse to have Malfoy in his life again), to make a plan that would ensure Malfoy’s mother safety now that his dad was out of the picture momentarily, he just needed to say the right words. To have the courage to stitch together his mission while still staying true to his heart.

“I know you’re up to something.”  

Malfoy’s eyes narrowed, his lips turned thin. Harry could see how much he wanted to deny the accusation as his body leaned away from Harry’s. (But they knew that he couldn’t. Not when it had been public knowledge about the downfall of the Malfoy name.)  

“We both know that you want sanctuary for your mum. I can give it to you.” Malfoy’s scoff hadn’t hid how skeptical and a cynic he was to hearing that. “Malfoy—” He got cut off.  

“Potter we both know that’s rubbish. If we’re going to be candid about this, I doubt you have that much influence in your little club against him to invoke a deal that would give my mother clemency.”  

“Do you always have to be such a pessimistic git? Malfoy, I know a thing or two about families with a bad history. I know you weren’t exactly that close to your dad compared to your mum. I’m giving you a chance.” For your pardon, for us, he wanted to add.  

Malfoy crossed his arms against his chest as a gust of chilly air blew through them. “Regardless of how distant I’ve been with my father, that doesn’t equate that I would leave him behind to the Dark Lord’s wrath. Malfoys pride themselves of being loyal to family. As such, your band of fans and bodyguards wouldn’t let my family in without something equal to exchange.”  

“Information.” Harry admitted. “They would want an insider to spy and give intel.” 

But that would be too dangerous for any grown adult let alone someone who was still in Hogwarts. He couldn’t gamble Malfoy’s life like that. Not when he was losing too many people from all sides.  

“Potter, just give it up. Leave me alone and keep your head down for all our sakes. What’s done is done.”

Harry stepped closer. “You can’t mean that. Malfoy, don’t walk away from this.” He grabbed one of Malfoy’s hands and placed it over his heart. “I know you want this.”  

Malfoy’s hands were cold, shivering from contact. “No, you don’t.”  

He stuttered. Looked so ready to give up, empty. Harry leaned further and angled for his lips to touch Malfoys when he whispered to him. “Don’t lie to yourself. I want you too.”  

“Don’t. Potter you don’t know what you’re starting.” Please almost escaped from his mouth.  

He trembled when Harry kissed him.




“I have been told you have acquired Potter’s affections.” His robes slid over to his shoes. In close proximity his red eyes pierced straight to his heart. “Good. Use that to your advantage and your mother will stay in perfect health. Is that understood?”  

“Yes, My Lord.”

summary: I'm not saying Draco was good...
body:
I’m not saying Draco was good…

What I’m saying is that he was boy. A boy who was born into a family of death eaters. A boy who was sent by his father to befriend Harry Potter, because he was told it would give him an advantage. What I’m saying is that he was constantly abused by his father and ignored by his mother. What I’m saying is that he was given the option of “do this or Voldemort will kill you,” and he’s judged and even hated for choosing life. I’m saying that when given the chance to save Harry, he tried.

I’m not saying that Draco was good. I’m saying he didn’t have a choice to decide who he was. He was always a Malfoy, for better or worse.

title: Gryffindors! ⚔
body:
- Repeats “I had to do it to ‘em” 24/7

- It starts getting so annoying one of the Ravenclaws casts a spell that makes them vomit every time they say that. It lasted for a day and there were approximately ten Gryffindors in the clinic that day

- Extreme Sweet Tooth™

- Although they have a strong opinion on candy and stuff, they generally hate none of it. Also they get really riled up when you hate on any candy or confection.

- Makes very good impressions of Gordon Ramsey??? For some reason???(”WHERE IS THE LAMB SAUCE?!?!!?”)

- Bean bags. All over the place. At one point there were so many there were bean bags on top of bean bags. One of them fell into the fire. It became such a big problem they donated some of them to Hufflepuff.

- Likes fencing a lot! They have a club at Hogwarts and 90% of the members are Gryffindors. The rest of them are Slytherins. Hufflepuffs and Ravenclaws don’t have time for “fake sword-fighting” (verbatim quote from Ravenclaw).

- Shows up late to like… every single class? Everybody just sees Gryffindor climbing in through a window into a classroom after it’s started as to not get caught being late and they’re like “same shit as always”

- In love with ketchup. They eat ketchup for breakfast. For lunch. For dinner. They’d divorce their spouse over ketchup. They’d murder someone over ketchup. It’s insane.

- They barely keep from murdering the Ravenclaws, since they HATE ketchup.

P.S. Sorry this one was kind of short! I might update it later with more headcanons. For now, sayonara!
